meanings.definition: The absence of a relationship or connection between two variables.
meanings.sent1: In the study, the researcher found clear noncorrelations between the temperature and the number of ice cream sales.
meanings.sent2: The scientist analyzed the data and concluded that there were noncorrelations between rainfall and crop yield.
meanings.sent3: The noncorrelations between the number of hours spent studying and exam scores left the students puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The noncorrelations between the colors of the cars and their speed on the highway were unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The noncorrelations between exercise frequency and weight loss were evident in the research findings.

meanings.definition: The lack of correlation between different sets of data.
meanings.sent1: The noncorrelations between the sales figures of the two products were surprising to the marketing team.
meanings.sent2: Researchers observed noncorrelations between the stock prices of the two companies over the past year.
meanings.sent3: The noncorrelations between the number of books read and intelligence levels sparked a lively debate among the students.
meanings.sent4: The noncorrelations between the traffic volume and time of day were highlighted in the traffic report.
meanings.sent5: The noncorrelations between the test scores of the two groups were evident in the statistical analysis.
